qas.question: When did Tibet and China sign a peace treaty?
Where does a bilingual account of Tibet and China's peace treaty exist?
When did a civil war over succession lead to the collapse of imperial Tibet?
What followed the collapse of imperial Tibet?
What was divided between warlords and tribes with no dominant centralized authority?
Who signed a peace treaty in 812/822 CE?
What stands outside the Lhasa temple in Jokhang?
What did a civil war in the mid-8th century lead to?
What did the Era of Succession follow?

context: In <a0_0>821/822 CE<a0_0/> <b5_0>Tibet and China<b5_0/> signed a peace treaty. A bilingual account of this treaty, including details of the borders between the two countries, is inscribed on <b6_0>a stone pillar<b6_0/> which stands outside the <a1_0>Jokhang temple in Lhasa<a1_0/>. Tibet continued as a Central Asian empire until the <a2_0>mid-9th century<a2_0/>, when <b8_0>a civil war<b8_0/> over succession led to the <b7_0>collapse of imperial Tibet.<b7_0/> The period that followed is known traditionally as the <a3_0>Era of Fragmentation<a3_0/>, when <a4_0>political control over Tibet<a4_0/> became divided between regional warlords and tribes with no dominant centralized authority.
